DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: SILVEIRA, D. S.;SILVEIRA, Denis S.;Silveira, Denis Silva da;daSilveira, Denis Silva;da Silveira, Denis Silva;DA SILVA, DENIS S.;Silva Silveira, Denis;Silveira, Denis Silva;Silveira, Denis;SILVA DA SILVEIRA, DENIS

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Denis Silva da Silveira is an Associate Professor in the Department of Administration at the Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE) in northeastern Brazil. He earned his PhD in Production Engineering from the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ) in 2009 and completed a postdoctoral fellowship at Nova University of Lisbon between 2015 and 2016. His research focuses on information systems architecture, conceptual modeling, semantic models, and user behavior. Over the years, he has strengthened his international presence by collaborating with researchers worldwide and publishing more than 190 works in journals, conferences, workshops, and book chapters. From 2013 to 2014, Denis led the information systems development line in the Information Management Division of the National Association of Graduate Programs and Research in Administration (ANPAD), one of Brazil's most prestigious research institutions. Currently, he serves on the editorial boards of several prominent international journals, including the International Journal of Simulation and Process Modelling, the Journal of Advances in Management Sciences Information Systems, and the Journal of Comprehensive Business Administration Research. In addition to his editorial roles, Denis actively contributes to leading scientific committees, such as the International Symposium on Business Modelling and Software Design (BMSD) and Research Challenges in Information Science (RCIS), where he evaluates emerging research in the field. He is also a frequent reviewer for high-impact international journals, shaping the future of research in Business Process Management (BPM) and Information Systems. Another notable aspect of his career is his role as an ad-hoc reviewer for Palgrave Macmillan, one of the worlds most respected academic publishers, where he assesses publications on BPM to ensure they meet the highest academic standards. Through his dedication to cutting-edge research and mentorship, Denis continues to influence the BPM and Information Systems fields, inspiring new researchers and contributing to the development of a dynamic and innovative academic community.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: ANIMARE: An Animation Method for Validation the Business Process
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project developed a method for validating business processes with respect to business rules. The method models the process as an UML activity diagram annotated with statements in Object Constraint Language (OCL) representing the business rules. This model is converted to an oriented graph, called control graph, which is decorated with the business rules. The model validation activity is performed by the animation of a set of scenarios, each one comprising the set of the objects required for the instance execution. Tracking each scenario animation along the control graph allows for the detection of situations that violate the correct process execution. The occurrence of these situations can be avoided by changing the process model or by introducing / altering the associated business rules.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project aimed at conducting a study on accessibility on the Web, evaluating Brazilian public organizations. This study identified the difficulties encountered by organizations during the process of accessing their Websites. For this, three tests were conducted, through a system that traveled the Internet and assessed the degree of compliance of the Websites with the accessibility guidelines. Subsequently, an online questionnaire was prepared for organizations. The results obtained directly with the organizations, through the questionnaires, and the results of the tests indicated that there are still some efforts on the path of accessibility in Brazil. However, the low number of accessible sites was an indicator that much work is still needed to make web accessibility a reality in Brazil.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Digital Libraries: Defining a Framework to Make It Accessible
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Accessibility on the Web implies making content available in a flexible way for all different groups of users. Therefore, Web developers should not ignore the differences between the users of these systems and must apply methods and techniques that help them in the challenge of allowing access to information available on the Web for everyone. Today, interest in digital libraries has grown significantly, bringing with it the need for accessible tools that facilitate the publication and retrieval of digital information. Digital libraries are usually developed with the intention of meeting the needs of a specific community. However, few of these services are designed as systems that can be reused in different contexts. Thereupon, it is important to create accessible general-purpose tools that lower costs and facilitate the development of digital libraries. Thus, the objective of this project is to specify and instantiate a framework to build accessible digital libraries for specific purposes.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: A acessibilidade na Web implica em disponibilizar o conteúdo de forma flexível para todos os diferentes grupos de usuários. Logo, o desenvolvedor Web não deveria ignorar as diferenças entre os usuários desses sistemas e deve saber aplicar métodos e técnicas que os auxiliem no desafio de permitir o acesso à informação disponível na Web para todos.Atualmente, o interesse em bibliotecas digitais cresceu significativamente trazendo consigo a necessidade de ferramentas acessíveis que facilitem a publicação e a recuperação de informações digitais. As bibliotecas digitais são desenvolvidas, normalmente, com a intenção de atender as necessidades de uma comunidade específica. Porém, poucos desses serviços são planejados como sistemas que possam ser reusados em diferentes contextos. Assim, é importante a criação de ferramentas acessíveis de propósito geral que diminuam os custos e facilitem o desenvolvimento de bibliotecas digitais.Em seus trabalhos, Ralph E. Johnson, define um framework como um projeto reusável para todos, ou parte dos elementos de um sistema, sendo representado como um conjunto de classes abstratas e um conjunto de regras que descrevem as interações entre as instâncias destas classes. Outra definição explorada por Johnson considera um framework como um arcabouço de uma aplicação que pode ser configurado pelo desenvolvedor da aplicação. As duas visões são complementares onde a primeira define a estrutura de um framework e a segunda a sua função. Tendo em vista o que foi apresentando, este projeto tem como objetivo principal especificar e instanciar um framework (uma arquitetura genérica) para construir bibliotecas digitais acessíveis com propósitos específicos.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Bibliotecas Digitais: Definindo um Framework para Torná-las Acessíveis

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Brazilian Symposium on Information Technology (in Portuguese, Simpósio Brasileiro de Tecnologia da Informação - SBTI)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The Brazilian Symposium on Information Technology (in Portuguese, Simpósio Brasileiro de Tecnologia da Informação - SBTI) is an event for the presentation of scientific papers and discussion of relevant topics in the field of Information Technology, bringing together students, researchers, professionals, and entrepreneurs. The strategic use of technology is crucial for contemporary organizations, as it enables competitive advantages through scenario analysis, decision-making support, and the definition and implementation of new organizational strategies. However, the incorporation of Information Technology in organizations brings forth new problems that require research focused on both conceptual and practical aspects. Research in Information Technology combines multidisciplinary aspects from fields such as Computer Science, Information Science, and Management, among others. Therefore, the organization of the SBTI aims to address this topic in a holistic and interdisciplinary manner, encouraging perspectives that seek to integrate the development, use, appropriation, and evolution of these technologies that are increasingly becoming more ubiquitous, pervasive, and mobile.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: II Simpósio Brasileiro em Tecnologia da Informação

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: A Creative Approach to Modeling Business Processes Through Creative Techniques
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A difficulty of process modeling is its multidisciplinary, which imposes on the requirements the need to establish a common vocabulary that transits both in the universe of specialists in the business area and in the technology area. However, in most associations what really occurs is a linguistic division between those involved. The main aim of this project was to devise an approach to reduce this linguistic division, using mental models (maps), to facilitate communication and simplify the modeling of an organization's common behavior and variables, making this process more agile and effective. In other words, unstructured and vague ideas, coming from specialists, through creative techniques (mind maps), easier to be taught and understood by the interested parties, to automatically transform into traditional requirements models, more specifically in process business models.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Uma Abordagem Criativa para Modelar Processos de Negócio por Meio de Técnicas Criativas

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: FACEPE/APQ (Nº 0648-6.02/15) Modularization of Quality Business Processes
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Currently, business process managers are looking for ways to provide greater agility and improve the performance of their processes. However, the implementation of these initiatives in organizations is hampered due to the granularity of the processes, possibly generated through a functional decomposition. According to the principle of functional decomposition, modeling should map the functions of an organization in a hierarchical way, starting from macroscopic functions, decomposing them, down to the subfunctions. One way to obtain functional decomposition is the identification and separation of concerns. The principle of separation of concerns takes care of human limitations in dealing with complexity, allowing the designer to focus on one subject or characteristic at a time. That is, modularize a solution so that each process is focused on solving only a single problem. In this context, the division of processes into modules (subprocesses), which contemplate only one concern, can reduce complexity, enabling greater understanding and facilitating maintenance and flexibility for the reuse of processes. Thus, it is interesting to note that in the notation of business process modeling (BPMN) there is no systematic mechanism that makes it possible to separate and evaluate the modularization of business process models. Therefore, this project aims to promote the systematization and evaluation of modularization in BPMN models. Hence, it is expected with the execution of this research to obtain the following results: (1) the evolution in the BPMN 2.0 metamodel so that it is possible to conceptually model the transversal characteristics. (2) the proposal, with the aid of the Goal-Question-Metric (GQM) approach, of a set of metrics for assessing the completeness and complexity of business process models.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CNPq Universal (N 433419/2018-0) Evaluation of Cognitive Effectiveness of Business Process Models
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This research project is a natural evolution of the research initiated previously through the FACEPE/APQ N 0648-6.02/15 and CNPq/MCTI N 444637/2015-0 calls for proposals, complementing the previous ones with the assessment of the cognitive effectiveness of business processes. This project proposes a method of empirical evaluation of business process language concrete syntax on the cognitive effectiveness involved on the understandability and on the ability to review these models by stakeholders that have little or no experience with the business process modeling language. To this end, we are proposing (and testing) a method for evaluating the cognitive effectiveness of business process modeling languages. The cognitive effectiveness is determined based on the ease, speed and accuracy to process the information illustrated on a requirements model. This method is based on empirical studies using the eye-tracking technology to investigate business process modeling languages.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This research project is a natural evolution of the research initiated previously through the FACEPE/APQ N 20/2014 and CNPq/MCTI N 25/2015 calls for proposals, complementing the previous ones with the assessment of the cognitive effectiveness of business processes. This project proposes a method of empirical evaluation of business process language concrete syntax on the cognitive effectiveness involved on the understandability and on the ability to review these models by stakeholders that have little or no experience with the business process modeling language. To this end, we are proposing (and testing) a method for evaluating the cognitive effectiveness of business process modeling languages. The cognitive effectiveness is determined based on the ease, speed and accuracy to process the information illustrated on a requirements model. This method is based on empirical studies using the eye-tracking technology to investigate business process modeling languages.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Evaluation of Cognitive Effectiveness of Business Process Models

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CNPq Universal (421085/2023-1) e FACEPE/APQ (N 0867- 6.02/22) An Infrastructure to Derive Requirements from Business Models
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Currently, the importance of business models is a fundamental concept for any organization. This happens because business model is an efficient tool to identify who is offering what to whom and is expects what in return. Not forgetting that they also must be expressed in the requirements models, as they are useful to understand how a business is organized, who interacts with whom, what objectives and strategies are being pursued; that is, what work the business performs and how it performs that work.Thus, business models have received special attention from two communities, namely: business administration and computer science. Due to the increasingly important role of information systems in the performance of business models, a mutual understanding for better interaction between these communities is essential. However, due to the different perspectives, the interaction between these two communities is rarely perfect, resulting in difficulties when it comes to understanding these models and the requirements they represent. In that event, this project focuses on an approach to systematize the design and possible derivations of business models up to the requirements of information systems, surely going over process models.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: MCTI/CNPQ (402986/2024-5) Integrating and Evaluating Business Values in BPMN Models
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This research project includes, among other elements, a postdoctoral fellowship, which will be carried out by me from January to October 2026 in Spain, more specifically at the Polytechnic University of Valencia. The approved project includes the extension of the BPMN language, with the introduction of a graphical artifact capable of explicitly representing business values in BPMN diagrams. Value perception, by its nature, is multifaceted and highly subjective, being influenced by a range of factors such as the quality of the service or product, price, and emotional, ethical, and social aspects. Individual variations in the interpretation of these factors can generate divergences between what is intentionally communicated in the models and how these values are effectively understood by stakeholders. Therefore, this project adopts fuzzy logic as an essential theoretical and methodological tool to deal with the imprecision and subjectivity inherent in value perception. Furthermore, the project aims to develop and validate an empirical method to examine how business values, graphically represented in BPMN models, are actually understood by stakeholders.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CNPq/MCTI (Nº 444637/2015-0) Systematizing the Configurable Processes Modeling for Public Administration
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A configurable business process represents multiple alternatives of a business process model, using concepts from the Software Product Line Engineering area, incorporating the term process variability, which refers to a family of processes, and a mechanism of configuration, allowing in project time to obtain an individualized process. However, business process modeling languages are often weak in their ability to describe multiple scenarios and rarely support configurable process models. Although some languages have this support, the problem of recovering variants of individual processes through the configuration of a reference model is not yet largely solved. These problems have a great impact on the reuse process at the design stage and, in addition, a rigid process logic becomes a heavy burden for the maintenance of the information systems corresponding to the business processes during their execution. Specifically observing the notation of business process modeling, there is no systematic mechanism for the elaboration of configurable business process models, hindering the adaptability and reuse of processes. The aim of this project was to capture points of variability in a process model, proposing a systematic approach to model both variability and composition, for later reuse of business processes in organizations. To this end, process models of the Brazilian public administration were used as a case study to validate the research results.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Research program on innovation in small businesses developed in partnership with SEBRAE and CNPq in the state of Pernambuco, prospecting 2400 small companies distributed across the cities of Pernambuco.
